verseObjects.text: Be merciful to me, God, be merciful to me,
for I take refuge in you until these troubles are over.
I stay under your wings for protection until this destruction is over.
I will cry to God Most High,
to God, who does all things for me.
He will send help from heaven and save me,
he is angry with those who crush me.
God will send me his loving kindness and his faithfulness.
I am among those who are ready to devour me.
I am among people whose teeth are spears and arrows,
and whose tongues are sharp swords.
Be exalted, God, above the heavens;
let your glory be above all the earth.
They spread out a net for my feet;
They dug a pit in front of me.
They themselves have fallen into the middle of it!
My heart is fixed, God, my heart is fixed;
I will sing, yes, I will sing praises.
Wake up, my honored heart; wake up, lute and harp;
I will wake up the dawn.
I will give thanks to you, Lord, among the peoples;
I will sing praises to you among the nations.
For great is your unfailing love, reaching to the heavens;
and your faithfulness to the clouds.
Be exalted, God, above the heavens;
may your glory be exalted over all the earth.

verseObjects.content: For the chief musician; set to Al Tashheth. A psalm of David. A michtam; when he fled from Saul, in the cave.
